abstract: Editorial warns new counterterrorism law being sought by Egyptian authorities would worsen already oppressive police state and embolden extremists by depriving citizens of legitimate avenues to express grievances; criticizes American officials for ignoring Egypt's rights violations and failing to demand human rights protections in exchange for foreign aid; argues that in releasing Egypt from such requirements America has become complicit in Egypt's repression.
lead_paragraph: A new security law promises to be more oppressive than the last, and American officials are missing their chance to put pressure on Cairo.

headline.main: With Washington’s Complicity, Egypt Cracks Down on Critics

snippet: A new security law promises to be more oppressive than the last, and American officials are missing their chance to put pressure on Cairo.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
